definition: successor/(attributive) future
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: What kind of government will bel behind for his successor?
sentences.chinese: 他将留给后任一个什么样的政府呢？

sentences.english: He served as eastern Zhejiang An Fusi Services Officer, rank over, lifting Taizhou worship Taoist.
sentences.chinese: 后任浙东安抚司参议官，秩满，提举台州崇道观。

sentences.english: They fulfilled all the tasks set forth in the political report.
sentences.chinese: 报告者详细阐述了今后任务中的种种困难。

sentences.english: He may leave even bigger ones for his own successor to fill.
sentences.chinese: 他或许会为后任留下更光辉的榜样。

sentences.english: Human rights groups have long appealed to successive government to repeal or amend these laws.
sentences.chinese: 人权组织长期呼吁后任政府废除或者修改这些法律。

sentences.english: What kind of government will be leave behind for his successor?
sentences.chinese: 他将留给后任一个什么样的政府呢？

sentences.english: Worked for CCTV as a news editing and then became an editor of People's Daily.
sentences.chinese: 曾在中央电视台做新闻编辑，后任人民日报总编辑。

definition: (of one person) to hold the successive posts of/(of several persons) the successive (presidents etc)
